chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Thomas E. Franz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Bond continued.
Successfully complete probation.

Supervision fees
$243 from case 14cf59 to be collected by DOC a a condition of Probation in Count 2 in Case 14cf87
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt: 11:15 a.m. Defendant Thomas E. Franz not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that defendant is in compliance. State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 11;16 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 am - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf59 and 14cf87.  In case 14cf59 - State moves to amend to 961.41 (3g)(b) - Possession of a Controlled Substance an unclassified misdemeanor - Granted.  In Case 14cf87 - State amends to Add Count 3 - 948.06 - Sex with Child Age 16 or Older - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire previously filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of 14cf59 and counst 2 and 3 in case 14cf87 but defers judgment on count 1 in case 14cf87.  Schiek/Richards/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cf59 - Jail 30 days W/huber for all purposes CS to reconfinement time - Court Costs - Probation to collect as courtesy in case 14cf87
14cf87 - Counts 2 and 3 - Concurrent
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
To collect Costs in Case 14cf59 as courtesy
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

11:40 am - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf59 and 14cf87.  Michlig reviews file in case 14cf87 - State files Victim Info from file.  Michlig does not believe proper notice was provided to all victims.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Bail continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

11:02 a.m. Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, in custody, with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF59. Schiek speaks close to resolution. Defendant in receipt of Information; reads waiving. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
No contact WHATSOEVER with Z.M.S.  No contact with co- defendants Michael Johnson or Carrie Steinmetz.  May have limited contact with Carrie Steinmetz limited to personal matters involving property.

03:06 pm - Defendant Thomas E. Franz in court, via video,  with attorney James D McKenzie.  Defendant Thomas E. Franz in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading.  Defense would like to waive preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Defendant requests modification to bond - specifically removing the no contact provision with Carrie Steinmetz.  Schiek does not object to removal of no contact with Carrie Steinmetz limited to personal matters involving property.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
No contact WHATSOEVER with Z.M.S.  No contact with co- defendants Michael Johnson or Carrie Steinmetz
